name: HyperVServer
author: AIT Gmbh & Co. KG
description: Remote control Hyper-V VMs and perform actions like start and stop VM, create or restore a snapshot (without SCVMM)
helpMarkDown: This step supports remote control of Hyper-V VMs and servers (without SCVMM). It supports starting and stopping a VM plus creating, restoring or deleting a VM snapshot.

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: The action that will be performed on the Hyper-V VM(s).

inputs.name: VMName
inputs.label: VM Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The VM name(s) on that the action should be performed. Multiple VM names are seperated by comma. e.g. Win7,Win8

inputs.name: Computername
inputs.label: Hostname
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NetBIOS, IP address and fully-qualified domain names are allowable to select the computer on which are the VMs.

inputs.name: SnapshotName
inputs.label: Snapshot Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The snapshot name of the VM(s) under the action should be performed.
inputs.visibleRule: Action = CreateSnapshot || Action = RestoreSnapshot || Action = RemoveSnapshot

inputs.name: StartVMStatusCheckType
inputs.label: Status Check Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The way to detect if a VM has been correctly started. Only valid for Start VM action.

inputs.name: StartVMWaitTimeBasedCheckInterval
inputs.label: Waiting Interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: The waiting period until it is assumed that the VM has been started correctly. The interval is specified in seconds. 0 or no value means a default value of 5 minutes.
